job.title: Data Integration Analyst
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Financial Services
job.description:
Allworth Financial (www.allworthfinancial.com) is an independent investment financial advisory firm that specializes in retirement planning, investment advising, and 401(k) management with a direct approach to financial planning. Allworth Financial delivers long- and short-term investment planning solutions and advice to help clients achieve their goals and plan strategically for retirement.
Allworth Financial is a high growth, private equity backed, Registered Investment Advisory business, headquartered in Sacramento, CA. The business is a $10 billion firm and is on track for continued growth through both acquisitions and strong organic growth. Allworth Financial was recognized as a Barron's Top 100 RIA in 2020.
Summary
As part of Allworth Financial's growth, the Finance team has created a new Data Integration position reporting to the VP of Analytics & Insights. The ideal candidate must have the following:
Strong organizational skills to work independently and with a team, set priorities, plan and coordinate multiple projects while adapting to changing priorities
Strong attention to detail and understand how various issues impact the company's overall data environment.
Tactful, solid business judgment with the ability to make business-savvy recommendations based on data analyzed
Responsibilities
Work directly with acquisition targets to conduct due diligence related to acquisition targets' data and infrastructure and report findings to data team
Meet with acquisition targets to scope/map data migration and conversions
Migrate data from acquisition targets' data platforms and integrate into Allworth's standard reporting structure
Requirements
Standard understanding of Excel
SQL Experience
Be able to effectively use joins, case statements, WHERE/GROUP BY/HAVING statements
Be able to use aggregate functions: SUM, MIN, MAX for exploratory data analysis
Preferably SQL Server experience, but not mandatory
Python Experience
Basic understanding of Built in Python features
Lists, Dictionaries, etc.
List and Dictionary comprehensions
Lambda functions
Error and exception handling
Experience with Jupyter Notebooks is a plus
Deep understanding of Pandas library
Prior experience with Salesforce a plus but not required
Ability to work with all levels of management
Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Computer Science or similar
Benefits
We value our associates' time and effort. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive base pay and an extensive benefits package including flexible work arrangements, paid time off, medical and other insurances, Retirement Benefit – 401K and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our associates, where people can learn and grow with the firm. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Typical reporting relationships are described, but actual relationships may vary in some instances. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, or knowledge required of personnel classified in this job.
